variant.summary: Timeline slider

variant.name: .VolumeSlider
variant.summary: Volume slider

histogram.name: Media.Controls.PlaybackSpeed
histogram.summary: Record the playback speed selected by the user in the list of playback speeds on the media controls.

histogram.name: Media.CrosGlobalMediaControls.PinAction
histogram.summary: Record each time user pins/unpins CrOS global media controls. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-04-24 to 2024-01-04; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.CrosGlobalMediaControls.RepeatUsageInQuickSetting
histogram.summary: Record each time media controls' sub-menu in quick settings is opened. True if it is a repeat usage. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-05-01 to 2024-01-04; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.CrosGlobalMediaControls.RepeatUsageOnShelf
histogram.summary: Record each time global media controls on the shelf is opened. True if it is a repeat usage. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-04-24 to 2024-01-04; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.D3D11.UnusedPictureBufferCount.MultiTexture
histogram.summary: This histogram lets us count how many PictureBuffers we've overallocated when we're allocating each texture separately. This case is relatively simple to optimize compared to SingleTexture.

histogram.name: Media.D3D11.UnusedPictureBufferCount.SingleTexture
histogram.summary: This histogram lets us count how many PictureBuffers we've overallocated when we're allocating in contiguous blocks. This case is harder to optimize than the MultiTexture variant, but it is good to know the proportion of the two of them to determine usage.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedAudioCodecHash
histogram.summary: Audio codec used in HTML5 media. Reporting corrected in M51 to include all detected audio codecs, not just those up to and including the first one supported.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedAudioCodecHash.Local
histogram.summary: Audio codec used in HTML5 media for a local file playback.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedContainer
histogram.summary: Container used for HTML5 media. Views that include pre-M34 data will categorize dash (38) and smooth streaming (39) in the "Other" bucket.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedContainer.Local
histogram.summary: Container used for HTML5 media for a local file playback.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedVideoCodecHash
histogram.summary: Video codec used in HTML5 media. Reporting corrected in M51 to include all detected video codecs, not just those up to and including the first one supported.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedVideoCodecHash.Local
histogram.summary: Video codec used in HTML5 media for a local file playback.

histogram.name: Media.DocumentPictureInPicture.CloseReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason why a document picture-in-picture window is closed (e.g. the user clicking on the Back to Tab button). Recorded on destruction of the picture-in-picture window.

histogram.name: Media.DocumentPictureInPicture.RequestedInitialHeight
histogram.summary: Records the height that the website has requested for a document picture-in-picture window. Recorded when calculating the initial bounds of a newly-opened document picture-in-picture window.

histogram.name: Media.DocumentPictureInPicture.RequestedInitialWidth
histogram.summary: Records the width that the website has requested for a document picture-in-picture window. Recorded when calculating the initial bounds of a newly-opened document picture-in-picture window. If the website requests a size larger than the area of the screen, it will be recorded as 100%. If a website does not request a size or requests a size of zero, it is recorded as 1%.

histogram.name: Media.DocumentPictureInPicture.RequestedLargeInitialSize
histogram.summary: Recorded when a website opens a document picture-in-picture window. Records `Occurred` if the website requested a window size larger than the maximum allowed window size, otherwise records `Did not occur`.

histogram.name: Media.DocumentPictureInPicture.RequestedLargeResize
histogram.summary: Recorded when a website resizes a document picture-in-picture window via the `resizeTo()` or `resizeBy()` APIs. Records `Occurred` if the website requested a window size larger than the maximum allowed window size, otherwise records `Did not occur`.

histogram.name: Media.DocumentPictureInPicture.RequestedSizeToScreenRatio
histogram.summary: Records the ratio of the total screen area that the website has requested for the picture-in-picture window, specifically the requested width times the requested height as a ratio of the screen's width times height. Recorded when calculating the initial bounds of a newly-opened document picture-in-picture window.

histogram.name: Media.DroppedFrameCount
histogram.summary: Count of dropped frames between pipeline start and stop. Media pipeline starts/stops when an HTML5 video is loaded/unloaded respectively in the browser.

histogram.name: Media.DroppedFrameCount2.{RendererType}.{ClearOrEncrypted}
histogram.summary: Monitors the DroppedFrameCount that is originated from a {RendererType} and the video playback is {ClearOrEncrypted}. It is the count of dropped video frames when an HTML5 video is unloaded.

histogram.name: Media.ElementCapture.ProduceTarget.Function.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of calls to RestrictionTarget.fromElement(). Specifically, this histogram tracks whether a new Promise was produced, and if not, why not. Another histogram tracks the result of new Promises, i.e. whether they were resolved or rejected.

histogram.name: Media.ElementCapture.ProduceTarget.Promise.Result
histogram.summary: When RestrictionTarget.fromElement() is called for the first time on a given Element, a new Promise is produced. This histogram tracks the result of this Promise - whether it was resolved or rejected.

histogram.name: Media.ElementCapture.RestrictTo.Latency
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of the time it takes for a BrowserCaptureMediaStreamTrack.restrictTo() call to resolve (either successfully or with an error). Note a call which never resolves won't be counted in this metric.

histogram.name: Media.ElementCapture.RestrictTo.Result
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of calls to BrowserCaptureMediaStreamTrack.restrictTo(). Recorded when resolving the promise produced by restrictTo().
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-09-20 to 2025-03-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmFileIO.FileSizeKBOnError
histogram.summary: Size in KB of the last file successfully read by the CDM through CDM FileIO before a specific error happens. This is reported only when the error happens, which should be rare.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmFileIO.FileSizeKBOnFirstRead
histogram.summary: Size in KB of the first file successfully read by the CDM through CDM FileIO. This is recorded once per CDM instance.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmFileIO.TimeTo.{FileOperation}{IncognitoOrNormal}
histogram.summary: The actual time spent by the CDM FileIO {FileOperation} operation under {IncognitoOrNormal} mode. Only recorded for successful operations.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmFileIO.WriteFile.DataSizeKB
histogram.summary: Size in KB of a file written by the CDM through CDM FileIO. This is recorded once per write through the CDM.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmFileIO.{FileOperation}{IncognitoOrNormal}
histogram.summary: Whether a CDM FileIO {FileOperation} operation succeded or not under {IncognitoOrNormal} mode.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmFileIO::OpenFile
histogram.summary: The status of file open received by MojoCdmFileIO. This is reported every time the CDM tries to open a file for read or write.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmHostVerificationStatus
histogram.summary: The status of CDM host verification. This is reported per CDM load.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmInterfaceVersion
histogram.summary: Chromium could support multiple versions of CDM interface. This metric records the CDM interface version that the CDM created by Chromium uses. This is recorded once per CDM instance.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmLoadErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code of a library CDM load failure. Only reported on Windows.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmLoadResult
histogram.summary: The result from an attempt to load a library CDM.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time spent to load a library CDM.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmProcessDebuggerAttached
histogram.summary: Counts every time a debugger is attached to a CDM utility process.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageDatabase.IncompatibleDatabaseDetected
histogram.summary: This UMA records when the CdmStorageDatabase for a profile is incompatible. This UMA is recorded on every OpenDatabase call that detects the database with a version number of one, which means that it is operating under a schema that does not include file_size and last_modified.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageDatabase.WriteFileForBigData
histogram.summary: This UMA records when the data being written to the CdmStorageDatabase exceeds 15 KB. This UMA is recorded on every write over 15KB that succeeds.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageDatabaseSQLiteError
histogram.summary: SQLite specific errors reported while using the Cdm Storage Database. Recorded on any error from a database operation.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageDatabaseSQLiteError.{CdmDatabaseOperation}
histogram.summary: This UMA records SQLite specific errors that occur when executing the operation {CdmDatabaseOperation}. This UMA is recorded on every error for this operation.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageDatabaseSQLiteError.{CdmDatabaseOperation}.{SqliteError}.Errno
histogram.summary: This UMA records the errno that occur when executing the operation {CdmDatabaseOperation} and getting a specific {SqliteError}. This UMA is recorded every time this operation errors with the specific {SqliteError}.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.CurrentDatabaseUsageKB.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA records the current CdmStorageDatabase size in KB. This UMA is recorded only once, on the first read, to retrieve usage levels of the CdmStorageDatabase.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.DatabaseOpenError
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from opening the CdmStorageDatabase. Recorded on every open.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.DatabaseOpenError.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from opening the CdmStorageDatabase. Recorded on every open from an {ProfileType} profile.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.DeleteFileError.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from the DeleteFile function. Recorded after every call of DeleteFile on {ProfileType} profile.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.DeleteForStorageKeyError.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from the DeleteForStorageKey function. Recorded after every call of DeleteForStorageKey on {ProfileType} profile.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.DeleteForTimeFrameError.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from the DeleteForTimeFrame function. Recorded after every call of DeleteForTimeFrame on {ProfileType} profile.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.GetSizeForFileError.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from the GetSizeForFile function. Recorded after every call of GetSizeForFile on {ProfileType} profile.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.GetSizeForStorageKeyError.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from the GetSizeForStorageKey function. Recorded after every call of GetSizeForStorageKey on {ProfileType} profile.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.GetSizeForTimeFrameError.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from the GetSizeForTimeFrame function. Recorded after every call of GetSizeForTimeFrame on {ProfileType} profile.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.kDeleteForFilterError.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from the DeleteForFilter function. Recorded after every call of DeleteForFilter on {ProfileType} profile.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.ReadFileError.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from the ReadFile function. Recorded after every call of ReadFile on {ProfileType} profile.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.WriteFileError.{ProfileType}
histogram.summary: This UMA logs overall error rates from the WriteFile function. Recorded after every call of WriteFile on {ProfileType} profile.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CrosCdmType
histogram.summary: Whether we used the platform CDM on Chrome OS that includes HW secure Widevine support, or fell back to the Chrome SW CDM. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-05-19 to 2025-09-01; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.EME.CrosPlatformCdm.SystemCode
histogram.summary: System code in promise rejection for ChromeOS platform CDM. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-01-05 to 2025-09-01; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.EME.DecoderBypassBlockCount
histogram.summary: Ratio of the number of decorder bypass blocks seen / total frames displayed * 100. Recorded for each video that could contain decoder bypass blocks.

histogram.name: Media.EME.EncryptedEvent
histogram.summary: Whether EME encrypted event has been fired. Every time a WebMediaPlayerImpl object is created a "false" value is reported to provide a baseline. Every time an encrypted event is fired, a "true" value will be reported. Note that it is possible to have multiple encrypted events during the lifetime of a WebMediaPlayerImpl object.

histogram.name: Media.EME.EncryptedMediaEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether encrypted media is enabled when requestMediaKeySystemAccess() is called. User can enable and disable encrypted media in content settings. Recorded when requestMediaKeySystemAccess() is called but will be reported at most once per renderer process.

histogram.name: Media.EME.EncryptionScheme.Initial.Audio
histogram.summary: The encryption scheme used by the audio stream in an HTML5 video. Reported when metadata is available if the initial config is encrypted.

histogram.name: Media.EME.EncryptionScheme.Initial.Video
histogram.summary: The encryption scheme used by the video stream in an HTML5 video. Reported when metadata is available if the initial config is encrypted.

histogram.name: Media.EME.IsIncognito
histogram.summary: Whether a given WebMediaPlayer instance, with a CDM attached, is played in an incognito window or in Chrome OS guest mode. Players that never started playback are excluded. Recorded once at time of player destruction.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaCryptoAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether MediaCrypto is available on a MediaDrm-based CDM. Reported once per MediaDrmBridge creation. In normal cases it should always be available.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaDrm.FirstApiLevel
histogram.summary: The Android Api level the device was released with, retrieved by obtaining |ro.product.first_api_level| from the OS. We record this once at time of checking the FirstApiLevel during the pre-provisioning flow.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaDrm.GetOriginIdResult
histogram.summary: The status of every attempt to obtain a pre-provisioned origin ID to be used by MediaDrm. This will only be reported for applications that use MediaDrmOriginIdManager.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaDrm.PreprovisionedOriginId.NonPerAppProvisioningDevice
histogram.summary: The number of pre-provisioned origin IDs available shortly after startup on devices that do not support per-application provisioning.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaDrm.PreprovisionedOriginId.PerAppProvisioningDevice
histogram.summary: The number of pre-provisioned origin IDs available shortly after startup on devices that support per-application provisioning.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaDrm.Provisioning
histogram.summary: Result of trying to provision an origin using MediaDrm. Called every time provisioning is attempted, once per origin.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaDrmBridge.KeySystemSupport
histogram.summary: Whether MediaDrmBridge supports the key system. Reported once per MediaDrmBridge creation. In normal cases it should always be supported.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationCdm.ActivateCdmFactory
histogram.summary: HRESULT of MediaFoundationCdmModule::ActivateCdmFactory(). This is only reported when ActivateCdmFactory() fails.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationCdm.LoadErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code of a library CDM load failure. Only reported on Windows.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationCdm.LoadResult
histogram.summary: The result from an attempt to load a library MediaFoundation CDM.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationCdm.LoadTime
histogram.summary: The time spent to load a library MediaFoundation CDM.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationCdm.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.FirstInitialize
histogram.summary: HRESULT of the first (and only the first) MediaFoundationCdm initialization in a MediaFoundationService process when using {KeySystem} in hardware secure mode. Reported on both successes and failures.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationCdm.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.Initialize
histogram.summary: HRESULT of MediaFoundationCdm initialization when using {KeySystem} in hardware secure mode. Only reported on failures.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationCdm.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.{EmeApi}
histogram.summary: HRESULT of MediaFoundationCdm and MediaFoundationCdmSession operations when using {KeySystem} in hardware secure mode.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.Crash2
histogram.summary: Whether a MediaFoundationService process crash is within 5 seconds after power or display change. Reported when the MediaFoundationService process crashes.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.ErrorAfterPowerOrDisplayChange2
histogram.summary: HRESULTs associated with errors happened in the MediaFoundationService process within 5 seconds after power or display change.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.ErrorNotAfterPowerOrDisplayChange2
histogram.summary: HRESULTs associated with errors happened in the MediaFoundationService process NOT within 2 seconds after power or display change.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.HardwareContextReset
histogram.summary: Whether a HardwareContextReset event happened in the MediaFoundationService process within 5 seconds after power or display change. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.HardwareContextReset.ActiveGpuDisplayInfo
histogram.summary: Active GPU's display information whether likely built-in or external when a HardwareContextReset event happened in the MediaFoundationService process. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.HardwareContextReset.ActiveGpuInfo
histogram.summary: Active and non-active GPU vendor information when a HardwareContextReset event happened in the MediaFoundationService process. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.HardwareContextReset.ActiveGpuVendorId
histogram.summary: Active GPU vendor ID when a HardwareContextReset event happened in the MediaFoundationService process. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.HardwareContextReset.DisplayCount
histogram.summary: The number of displays when a HardwareContextReset event happened in the MediaFoundationService process. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.HardwareContextReset.DoesGpuMatchWithDisplayOnMultiGpu
histogram.summary: Whether or not the active GPU matches with the display GPU on multi-GPU devices when a HardwareContextReset event happened in the MediaFoundationService process. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.HardwareContextReset.GpuCount
histogram.summary: The number of GPUs when a HardwareContextReset event happened in the MediaFoundationService process. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.HardwareContextReset.MultiGpuNvidiaActiveWithExternalDisplay
histogram.summary: Whether or not a multi-GPU device has NVIDIA active GPU associated with an external displays when a HardwareContextReset event happened in the MediaFoundationService process. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.HardwareContextReset.MultiGpuWithExternalDisplay
histogram.summary: Whether or not a multi-GPU device has an active GPU associated with an external displays when a HardwareContextReset event happened in the MediaFoundationService process. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.HardwareContextReset.NonActiveGpuVendorId
histogram.summary: Non-active GPU vendor ID when a HardwareContextReset event happened in the MediaFoundationService process. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.IsKeySystemSupported
histogram.summary: Time for MediaFoundationService.IsKeySystemSupported() to finish. Reported once per browser session lifetime.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.GetCdmCapability
histogram.summary: The time spent to get CdmCapability for {KeySystem}. The value will be reported once per CDM instance for hw security in MediaFoundationService. This value will only be reported for successful retrievals of the CDM Capability.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.IsTypeSupported
histogram.summary: Time for IMFContentDecryptionModuleFactory::IsTypeSupported() to finish in MediaFoundationService when using {KeySystem} in hardware secure mode, which are called by MediaFoundationService.IsKeySystemSupported() (called once per browser session lifetime). IsKeySystemSupported() calls IsTypeSupported() multiple times, for different audio/video codecs and encryption schemes.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MediaFoundationService.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.IsTypeSupportedEx
histogram.summary: Time for IMFExtendedDRMTypeSupport::IsTypeSupportedEx() to finish in MediaFoundationService when using {KeySystem} in hardware secure mode, which are called by MediaFoundationService.IsKeySystemSupported() (called once per CDM per browser session lifetime). IsKeySystemSupported() calls IsTypeSupportedEx() multiple times, for different audio/video codecs and encryption schemes.

histogram.name: Media.EME.MojoCdm.ConnectionError
histogram.summary: Whether connection error has happened for MojoCdm. Every time a MojoCdm object is created a "false" value is reported to provide a baseline. Every time a mojo connection error happened, a "true" value will be reported, which typically means a remote CDM process crash.

histogram.name: Media.EME.OutputProtection
histogram.summary: Output protection query status and result. One query and one positive (no unprotected external links) result (if any) are reported per CDM instance.

histogram.name: Media.EME.OutputProtection.PlatformCdm
histogram.summary: Output protection query status and result. One query and one positive (no unprotected external links) result (if any) are reported per CDM instance. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-01-05 to 2025-09-01; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.EME.RequestMediaKeySystemAccess.{KeySystem}
histogram.summary: {KeySystem} support query status and result, as reported by RequestMediaKeySystemAccess. Each value will be reported at most once per frame.

histogram.name: Media.EME.RequestMediaKeySystemAccess.{KeySystem}.TimeTo.Reject
histogram.summary: The time spent to reject RequestMediaKeySystemAccess() for {KeySystem}. Each time will be reported at most once per process. Only one of TimeTo.Resolve or TimeTo.Reject will be reported at most once per process for a {KeySystem}.

histogram.name: Media.EME.RequestMediaKeySystemAccess.{KeySystem}.TimeTo.Resolve
histogram.summary: The time spent to resolve RequestMediaKeySystemAccess() for {KeySystem}. Each time will be reported at most once per process. Only one of TimeTo.Resolve or TimeTo.Reject will be reported at most once per process for a {KeySystem}.

histogram.name: Media.EME.UrlProvisionFetcher.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: The net error or HTTP response code of provisioning requests made by UrlProvisionFetcher on Android and Cast devices.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.HardwareSecure.ClearLeadSupport.{VideoCodec}
histogram.summary: Record for whether clear lead content is supported by the platform for hardware security. This is reported only on Windows devices, only when codec is supported for hardware security, per codec, and once per browser session lifetime.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.HardwareSecure.Pref
histogram.summary: Whether Media Foundation Widevine CDM is enabled or disabled based on previous disabled timestamps in "Local State" pref. This is reported once per browsing session around browser startup time if Media Foundation Widevine CDM is enabled and available.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.LibraryCdmAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the CDM is available for Widevine or not. In normal cases, this is reported once per render process if the EME API is used. In rare cases it could be reported more than once if the CDM is not available and then is component updated.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.SoftwareSecure.SystemCode
histogram.summary: System code in promise rejection when using Widevine key system in software secure mode.

histogram.name: Media.EME.Widevine.VideoCapability.HasEmptyRobustness
histogram.summary: Whether the robustness level of any video capability in the supported configuration passed into requestMediaKeySystemAccess() is empty. This is specific to the Widevine key system.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.CdmCapabilityQueryStatus.CreateDummyMediaFoundationCdmHresult
histogram.summary: HRESULT code if CreateDummyMediaFoundationCdm call fails when querying hardware secure CDM capability.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.CdmCapabilityQueryStatus.MediaFoundationGetCdmFactoryHresult
histogram.summary: HRESULT code if MediaFoundationCdmModule::GetCdmFactory call fails when querying Widevine CDM capability.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.CreateCdm
histogram.summary: Whether the CDM instance is created successfully for {KeySystem}. Reported each time a CDM instance creation is attempted, usually as a result of Javascript call of createMediaKeys().

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.CreateCdmStatus
histogram.summary: The status when creating a CDM instance for {KeySystem}. Reported each time a CDM instance creation is attempted, usually as a result of Javascript call of createMediaKeys().

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.CreateCdmTime
histogram.summary: Time took to create the CDM instance for {KeySystem}.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.CreateSession.SessionType
histogram.summary: EME session type passed into CreateSession.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.GenerateRequest.MojoCdmTimeout
histogram.summary: The timeout status of MojoCdm::CreateSessionAndGenerateRequest() call.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.AllowedForSite
histogram.summary: Whether Media Foundation based CDM is enabled or disabled based on previous disabled timestamps in a "User Profile" pref. This is reported once per browsing session when user requests hardware secure playback if Media Foundation based CDM is enabled and available.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.CdmCapabilityQueryStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the CDM capability query. This can be used to inspect the reason when no capability reported. Reported at most once per browser session per key system when EME query is triggered by a website.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.CdmInfoStatus
histogram.summary: The CdmInfo::Status of {KeySystem} hardware secure CDM capability. Reported at most once per browser session when EME query is triggered by a website.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.Support
histogram.summary: When hardware secure decryption is enabled, whether Widevine hardware secure decryption is actually supported by the platform (device). Reported at most once per browser session when EME query is triggered by a website, and when Widevine hardware secure CDM was registered.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.HardwareSecure.Support.{VideoCodec}
histogram.summary: When hardware secure decryption is enabled and supported by Widevine, whether {VideoCodec} video codec is supported by the platform (device). Reported at most once per browser session when EME query is triggered by a website, and when Widevine hardware secure CDM was registered.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.InitialKeyStatusMix
histogram.summary: Reports a summary of key statuses associated with an EME CDM session. Reported once per EME CDM session on the first key statuses update.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.KeyStatusSystemCode
histogram.summary: System code associated with key status for {KeySystem}.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.LastKeyStatusMix
histogram.summary: Reports a summary of key statuses associated with an EME CDM session. Reported once per EME CDM session on the last key statuses update when the EME CDM session gest closed.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.TimeTo{ResolveOrReject}.{EmeApi}
histogram.summary: The time it takes to {ResolveOrReject} a EME promise.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.WaitingForKey
histogram.summary: Reports whether a playback with a CDM attached has been blocked waiting for the CDM to be set or waiting for decryption key. Reported once per playback when a CDM attached.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.{EmeApi}
histogram.summary: Result of EME promises that were handled by Chromium code.

histogram.name: Media.EME.{KeySystem}.{EmeApi}.SystemCode
histogram.summary: System code in promise rejection.

histogram.name: Media.FallbackToHighLatencyAudioPath2
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome had to fallback to the high latency audio path or not. The fallback might be from either low latency offload path, or from low latency non-offload path.

histogram.name: Media.FrameInfo.GuessedInitialCodedSizeSuccess
histogram.summary: Indicates if the guessed coded size would have matched the real coded size. Recorded on acquisition of real coded size for the first frame of playback.

histogram.name: Media.FrameReadBackCount.{RendererType}
histogram.summary: Monitors the number of video frames being read back from a {RendererType}. It is the count of video frames being read back from an HTML5 video when it is unloaded.

histogram.name: Media.GetDisplayMedia.BasicFlow.Win.GetApplicationIdResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of trying to get the application ID of an application whose window was selected in the getDisplayMedia() media picker on Windows.

histogram.name: Media.GetDisplayMedia.Constraints.DisplaySurface
histogram.summary: Records whether getDisplayMedia was called with the displaySurface constraint.

histogram.name: Media.GetDisplayMedia.Constraints.MonitorTypeSurfaces
histogram.summary: Records whether getDisplayMedia was called with the monitorTypeSurfaces constraint.

histogram.name: Media.GetDisplayMedia.Constraints.RestrictOwnAudio
histogram.summary: Records whether getDisplayMedia was called with the RestrictOwnAudio constraint.

histogram.name: Media.GetDisplayMedia.Constraints.SelfBrowserSurface
histogram.summary: Records whether getDisplayMedia was called with the selfBrowserSurface constraint.

histogram.name: Media.GetDisplayMedia.Constraints.SuppressLocalAudioPlayback
histogram.summary: Records whether getDisplayMedia was called with the suppressLocalAudioPlayback constraint.

histogram.name: Media.GetDisplayMedia.Constraints.SurfaceSwitching
histogram.summary: Records whether getDisplayMedia was called with the surfaceSwitching constraint.

histogram.name: Media.GetDisplayMedia.Constraints.SystemAudio
histogram.summary: Records whether getDisplayMedia was called with the systemAudio constraint.

histogram.name: Media.GetDisplayMedia.Constraints.WindowAudio
histogram.summary: Records whether getDisplayMedia was called with the windowAudio constraint.

histogram.name: Media.GetDisplayMedia.RequiresUserActivationResult
histogram.summary: Records whether getDisplayMedia was called with a user gesture (transient activation) or whether it wasn't required. The requirement is only enforced once `blink::features::kGetDisplayMediaRequiresUserActivation` is enabled and can be bypassed with the `ScreenCaptureWithoutGestureAllowedForOrigins` policy.

histogram.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.DeviceSelectorAvailable
histogram.summary: Records if the Global Media Controls device selector was available. Recorded once per notification either when the device selector was shown or when the notification disappears.

histogram.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.DeviceSelectorOpened
histogram.summary: Records if the Global Media Controls device selector was opened. Recorded once per notification either when the device selector was opened or when the notification disappears. This histogram is only recorded if the device selector was available.

histogram.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.DismissReason
histogram.summary: Recorded each time a media session is dismissed or removed from the Global Media Controls. Records the reason why it happened (e.g. user clicked the dismiss button or playback stopped).

histogram.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.EntryPoint
histogram.summary: Records the entry point whenever the user opens the Global Media Controls UI.

histogram.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.InteractionDelayAfterPause
histogram.summary: Recorded each time a paused media session is interacted with (e.g. playing the media or clicking on the notification to go back to the tab). Records the time passed since it was last interacted with (or since when it was paused if this is the first post-pause interaction).

histogram.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.MediaCastMode.{Action}
histogram.summary: Records the type of Media Route that users {Action} from the Global Media Controls dialog. Recorded when users click on a button and this histogram doesn't represent the actual number of sessions {Action}ed from the GMC dialog.

histogram.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.MediaItemUIUpdatedViewAction
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user action is performed on the updated media item UI view in the media dialog view on non-CrOS desktop platforms.

histogram.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.NumberOfAvailableAudioDevices
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the Global Media Controls Device picker dialog is opened and is populated with devices. Records the number of device options displayed, possibly including the default fallback device.

histogram.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.RepeatUsage
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the Global Media Controls dialog is opened. True if this was repeat usage of the dialog (e.g. if it's not the first time the dialog has been opened this session).

histogram.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.UserActionFocus
histogram.summary: The focused state of the WebContents associated with the MediaSession that the user is interacting with via the Global Media Controls. Recorded when the user presses an action on the Global Media Controls dialog (e.g. play).

histogram.name: Media.GPU.OutputFormatHardwareGmb
histogram.summary: Records the format used for creating video frames with hardware backed GpuMemoryBuffers. Result is an enum that represents OutputFormat in GpuMemoryBufferVideoFramePool. Recorded once per VideoFrame creation.

histogram.name: Media.GPU.OutputFormatSoftwareGmb
histogram.summary: Records the format used for creating video frames with software backed GpuMemoryBuffers. Result is an enum that represents OutputFormat in GpuMemoryBufferVideoFramePool. Recorded once per VideoFrame creation.

histogram.name: Media.GpuArcVideoDecodeAccelerator.InitializeFailed
histogram.summary: Counts the unsuccessful calls to GpuArcVideoDecodeAccelerator::Initialize() per VideoCodecProfile. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-01-05 to 2025-09-01; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.GpuArcVideoDecodeAccelerator.InitializeSucceeded
histogram.summary: Counts the successful calls to GpuArcVideoDecodeAccelerator::Initialize() per VideoCodecProfile. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-01-05 to 2025-09-01; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.GpuArcVideoDecodeAccelerator.InstanceCount.All
histogram.summary: Counts how many GpuArcVideoDecodeAccelerator instances are alive at the time a new GpuArcVideoDecodeAccelerator is created. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-01-22 to 2023-06-21; data may be missing. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-06-22 to 2025-09-01; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.GpuArcVideoDecodeAccelerator.InstanceCount.Initialized
histogram.summary: Counts how many GpuArcVideoDecodeAccelerator instances that have gone through initialization (i.e., have an underlying media::VideoDecodeAccelerator) are alive at the time a GpuArcVideoDecodeAccelerator goes through initialization and successfully creates its underlying media::VideoDecodeAccelerator. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-01-22 to 2023-06-21; 2024-06-22 to 2025-09-01; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.GpuMemoryBufferVideoFramePool.UnsupportedFormat
histogram.summary: GpuMemoryBufferVideoFramePool is called with an unsupported VideoFrame pixel format. Emitted on VideoFrame arrival.

histogram.name: Media.HardwareAudioChannelCount
histogram.summary: Channel count of the hardware audio device.

histogram.name: Media.HardwareAudioChannelLayout
histogram.summary: Channel layout of the hardware audio device.

histogram.name: Media.HardwareAudioSamplesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Samples per second of the hardware audio device.

histogram.name: Media.HardwareKeyPressed
histogram.summary:
Records media key presses that are handled by the HardwareKeyMediaController.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-08-29 to 2023-10-24; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.HasAcceleratedVideoDecode.{CodecType}
histogram.summary: Tracks accelerated video decoding support for a given codec. Recorded once per GPU process after an attempt to use accelerated video decoding.

histogram.name: Media.HasEverPlayed
histogram.summary: Whether a given WebMediaPlayer instance, after preload, started playback; recorded once at time of player destruction.

histogram.name: Media.HLS.Adaptation
histogram.summary: Logs what caused HLS stream adaptation. Recorded each time adaptation takes place.

histogram.name: Media.HLS.AdvancedFeatureTags
histogram.summary: Logs an enum representing the presence of specific HLS tags which are used to trigger features of the demuxer, including gaps, discontinuities, and encryption, among others. Recorded whenever MediaPlayer successfully plays HLS media using one of the advanced features in the enum.

histogram.name: Media.HLS.CrossOriginContent
histogram.summary: Logs whether HLS playback uses cross-origin content. Recorded once per player.

histogram.name: Media.HLS.EncryptionMode
histogram.summary: Logs the encryption mode used if a playlist has the #EXT-X-KEY or #EXT-X-SESSION-KEY tags present. Recorded whenever MediaPlayer successfully plays encrypted HLS media.

histogram.name: Media.HLS.InitializationError
histogram.summary: Logs any error which occurs during initialization of the hls demuxer.

histogram.name: Media.HLS.LiveContent
histogram.summary: Logs whether HLS playback is for Live content, as opposed to video-on-demand (VOD) content. Recorded once per player.

histogram.name: Media.HLS.MultivariantPlaylist
histogram.summary: Logs whether HLS playback uses a multivariant (as opposed to plain media) playlist. Recorded once per player.

histogram.name: Media.HLS.ParserError
histogram.summary: Logs any error which is caused by manifest parsing during either demuxer initialization or mid-playback.

histogram.name: Media.HLS.PlaybackError
histogram.summary: Logs any error which occurs during playback but NOT during initialization of the hls demuxer.

histogram.name: Media.HLS.UnparsableManifest
histogram.summary: Logs the root cause failure reason for a playlist which cannot be parsed by the built-in parser, but was successfully played by AndroidMediaPlayer. Recorded whenever MediaPlayer successfully plays HLS media from a manifest that the builtin parser would fail to parse.

histogram.name: Media.InitializeRendererTimeout
histogram.summary: The timeout status of Renderer initialization.

histogram.name: Media.InputErrorMac
histogram.summary: Error codes that we encounter while setting up an AUAudioInputStream on Mac.

histogram.name: Media.InputStreamDuration
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of low-latency audio input streams. Sampled when the stream is closed by the AudioInputController.

histogram.name: Media.InputStreamDurationWithoutCallback
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of low-latency audio input streams which never got any callbacks. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-10-11 to 2021-06-04; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.LoadType
histogram.summary: Load type of HTML5 media, such as URL, MediaSource and MediaStream.

histogram.name: Media.LowLatencyAudioCaptureStartupSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether capture started successfully after a low-latency input stream startup was requested.

histogram.name: Media.MeanTimeBetweenRebuffers{MediaRebufferingCategories}
histogram.summary: The total watch time (see Media.WatchTime) of a given playback divided by the number of rebuffering events that occured during that playback. Only reported when rebuffering happened. Therefore, alway refer to other UMAs like `Media.RebuffersCount` when checking this UMA. {MediaRebufferingCategories}

histogram.name: Media.MediaCodecError.NegativeCodecExceptionErrorCode
histogram.summary: Negative error code from a CodecException reported by MediaCodec. Reported whenever MediaCodec returns a CodecException, and the CodecException is unknown and a negative value.

histogram.name: Media.MediaCodecError.{VideoCodec}.{Secure}
histogram.summary: Error reported by MediaCodec video streams using codec {VideoCodec} with {Secure}. Reported at most once per playback if an error occurs.

variant.name: HardwareSecure
variant.summary: hardware secure decryption

variant.name: SoftwareSecure
variant.summary: software secure decryption

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.EnumerateDevices.FirstStateOnContextDestroyed
histogram.summary: Tracks the state of the first enumerateDevices call in relation to the first successful getUserMedia call. Recorded on execution context destruction only if there was at least one enumerateDevices call.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.EnumerateDevices.GetUserMediaInteraction
histogram.summary: Recorded when the first enumerateDevices call and/or the first successful getUserMedia call are resolved. The members of the histogram are not mutually exclusive.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.EnumerateDevices.Latency
histogram.summary: The latency of calls to the navigator.mediaDevices.enumerateDevices() API which resolve, including both successes and failures. Note very long calls which record a EnumerateDevices.Result of kTimedOut but do eventually resolve will have their latency recorded.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.EnumerateDevices.Result
histogram.summary: The results of all calls to the navigator.mediaDevices.enumerateDevices() API, including successful promise resolutions, error codes, or kTimedOut, if the promise was still pending after 4 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.GetAllScreensMedia.Latency
histogram.summary: The latency of calls to the navigator.mediaDevices.GetAllScreensMedia() API which resolve, including both successes and failures. Note very long calls which record a GetAllScreensMedia.Result of kTimedOut but do eventually resolve will have their latency recorded.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.GetAllScreensMedia.Result2
histogram.summary: The results of all calls to the navigator.mediaDevices.GetAllScreensMedia() API, including successful promise resolutions, error codes, or kTimedOut, if the promise was still pending after 6 seconds. The suffix 2 was added at milestone 138, after kNotAllowedByUserError was added.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.GetDisplayMedia.Audio.PermissionDeniedBySystem
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of attempts to start an audio track from getDisplayMedia that results in PermissionDeniedBySystem. This is recorded in UserMediaProcessor::RequestInfo::OnTrackStarted when the result of the attempt to start the track is availble.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.GetDisplayMedia.Latency2
histogram.summary: The latency of calls to the navigator.mediaDevices.GetDisplayMedia() API which resolve, including both successes and failures. Note very long calls which record a GetDisplayMedia.Result of kTimedOut but do eventually resolve will have their latency recorded. The suffix 2 was added in milestone 143, after the kTimedOut interval was increased from 12s to 30s.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.GetDisplayMedia.Result2
histogram.summary: The results of all calls to the navigator.mediaDevices.GetDisplayMedia() API, including successful promise resolutions, error codes, or kTimedOut, if the promise was still pending after 30 seconds. The suffix 2 was added at milestone 138, after kNotAllowedByUserError was added.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.GetUserMedia.CameraCaptureCapability
histogram.summary: When getUserMedia() is called for video, the capture resolution capabilities of the devices (webcams) are logged, including if HD/FullHD devices support 360p, 480p, neither or both.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.GetUserMedia.EchoCancellationMode
histogram.summary: When getUserMedia() is called for audio, the utilized echoCancellationMode is logged. The mode controls how much of the user system playout is removed from the microphone signal.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.GetUserMedia.Latency
histogram.summary: The latency of calls to the navigator.mediaDevices.GetUserMedia() API which resolve, including both successes and failures. Note very long calls which record a GetUserMedia.Result of kTimedOut but do eventually resolve will have their latency recorded.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.GetUserMedia.Result2
histogram.summary:
The results of all calls to the navigator.mediaDevices.GetUserMedia() API, including successful promise resolutions, error codes, or kTimedOut, if the promise was still pending after 8 seconds.
The suffix 2 was added at milestone 138, after kNotAllowedByUserError was added.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevices.SaltDatabaseErrors
histogram.summary: Errors reported by SQLite while initializing or using the media-device salt database.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevicesManager.VideoDeviceEnumeration.Result
histogram.summary: The success or failure code of MediaDevicesManager requests to enumerate video devices (ie cameras) with the camera capture service.

histogram.name: Media.MediaDevicesManager.VideoDeviceEnumeration.Start
histogram.summary: Count of MediaDevicesManager starting enumerating video devices (ie cameras) with the camera capture service, including enumerations which never finished.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundation.MediaEngineError.{MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_ERR}.Hresult
histogram.summary: Hresult corresponding to a {MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_ERR}. Recorded when the MediaEngine hits an error from Event Notify.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundation.MF_E_TOPO_CODEC_NOT_FOUND.{VideoCodec}
histogram.summary: This histogram is recorded when MediaEngine hits an error corresponding to the HRESULT MF_E_TOPO_CODEC_NOT_FOUND from Event Notify. This histogram records the VideoCodec as part of the name, and reports the AudioCodec, so we have both to look at the combination of codecs used when this HRESULT occurs.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationAudioDecoder.CreateDecoderFailure.XheAac
histogram.summary: HRESULT error codes from MediaFoundationAudioDecoder::CreateDecoder() when trying to initialize a decoder for XHE-AAC.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.CreateMediaEngineError
histogram.summary: Recorded when the MediaFoundationRenderer::CreateMediaEngine() fails.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.D3D11CreateDeviceFailed
histogram.summary: Recorded when the MediaFoundationRenderer fails to execute D3D11CreateDevice.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.ErrorReason
histogram.summary: Recorded when the MediaFoundationRenderer or MediaFoundationRendererClient hits an error.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.FailedToSetDCompMode
histogram.summary: Recorded when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits an error when trying to set direct composition mode.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.InvalidHwdrmState.HasReportedPlaying
histogram.summary: Whether or not playback has started when DRM_E_TEE_INVALID_HWDRM_STATE happens in MediaFoundationRenderer.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.InvalidHwdrmState.VideoFrameDecoded
histogram.summary: The number of video frames decoded when DRM_E_TEE_INVALID_HWDRM_STATE happens in MediaFoundationRenderer.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.MultiGpu.ActiveGpuDisplayInfo
histogram.summary: Active GPU's display information whether likely built-in or external when the MediaFoundationRenderer starts a playback. Reported only once such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.MultiGpu.ActiveGpuInfo
histogram.summary: Active and non-active GPU vendor information when the MediaFoundationRenderer starts a playback. Reported only once such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.MultiGpu.ActiveGpuVendorId
histogram.summary: Active GPU vendor ID when the MediaFoundationRenderer starts a playback. Reported only once such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.MultiGpu.DisplayCount
histogram.summary: The number of displays when the MediaFoundationRenderer starts a playback. Reported only once such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.MultiGpu.DoesGpuMatchWithDisplayOnMultiGpu
histogram.summary: Whether or not the active GPU matches with the display GPU on multi-GPU devices when the MediaFoundationRenderer starts a playback. Reported only once such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.MultiGpu.GpuCount
histogram.summary: The number of GPUs when the MediaFoundationRenderer starts a playback. Reported only once such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.MultiGpu.MultiGpuNvidiaActiveWithExternalDisplay
histogram.summary: Whether or not a multi-GPU device has NVIDIA active GPU associated with an external displays when the MediaFoundationRenderer starts a playback. Reported only once such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.MultiGpu.MultiGpuWithExternalDisplay
histogram.summary: Whether or not a multi-GPU device has an active GPU associated with an external displays when the MediaFoundationRenderer starts a playback. Reported only once such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.MultiGpu.NonActiveGpuVendorId
histogram.summary: Non-active GPU vendor ID when the MediaFoundationRenderer starts a playback. Reported only once such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.PlaybackError
histogram.summary: Recorded when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits a playback error. Some errors are part of the normal user flow (e.g. sleep/resume) and are not a bug.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.PlaybackError.ActiveGpuDisplayInfo
histogram.summary: Active GPU's display information whether likely built-in or external when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits a playback error. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.PlaybackError.ActiveGpuInfo
histogram.summary: Active and non-active GPU vendor information when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits a playback error. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.PlaybackError.ActiveGpuVendorId
histogram.summary: Active GPU vendor ID when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits a playback error. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.PlaybackError.DisplayCount
histogram.summary: The number of displays when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits a playback error. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.PlaybackError.DoesGpuMatchWithDisplayOnMultiGpu
histogram.summary: Whether or not the active GPU matches with the display GPU on multi-GPU devices when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits a playback error. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.PlaybackError.GpuCount
histogram.summary: The number of GPUs when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits a playback error. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.PlaybackError.MultiGpuNvidiaActiveWithExternalDisplay
histogram.summary: Whether or not a multi-GPU device has NVIDIA active GPU associated with an external displays when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits a playback error. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.PlaybackError.MultiGpuWithExternalDisplay
histogram.summary: Whether or not a multi-GPU device has an active GPU associated with an external displays when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits a playback error. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.PlaybackError.NonActiveGpuVendorId
histogram.summary: Non-active GPU vendor ID when the MediaFoundationRenderer hits a playback error. Reported whenever such an event happens.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.RenderedVideoFrameDetectionResult
histogram.summary: Recorded when the MediaFoundationRenderer detects one or more rendered video frame within the given time. Only reported once per playback.

histogram.name: Media.MediaFoundationRenderer.RenderedVideoFrameDetectionResult.TimeTo.{ResultReason}
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from when MediaFoundationRenderer reports the result whether one or more rendered video frame within the given time for {ResultReason}. Only reported once per playback.

histogram.name: Media.MediaHistory.DatabaseExists
histogram.summary: Whether or not the media history database exists. Called on the initialization of the profile.

histogram.name: Media.MediaLauncherActivityStarted
histogram.summary: Recorded when the MediaLauncherActivity starts up. Records the reaosn that MediaLauncherActivity is enabled.

histogram.name: Media.MediaPlaybackWhileNotVisible.InterruptionType
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason for the HTMLMediaElement being interrupted when the frame is being controlled by the MediaPlaybackWhileNotVisible permission policy and the frame is not visible.

histogram.name: Media.MediaRecorder.Codec
histogram.summary: The codec and hardware/software variant used by MediaRecorder, recorded once when the VideoTrackRecorder initializes the encoder.

histogram.name: Media.MediaRecorder.Codec.{Query}.{Result}
histogram.summary: Codec queried through MediaRecorder{Query} where the result is {Result}. Logged when the call is made.

histogram.name: Media.MediaRecorder.HasCorrectAV1CodecString
histogram.summary: Record the correctness of the AV1 codecs string configured in MediaRecorder and queried in MediaCapabilities. It is recorded when Initialize() in MediaRecorder API is called and the capability is queried in MediaCapabilities API.

histogram.name: Media.MediaRecorder.TrackTransformationChangeCount
histogram.summary: The number of transformation changes received on a recorded video track. Recorded when a MediaRecorder has stopped recording. 0 means there were no frames delivered to the recorder. 1 means the first frame did or did not have transformation information attached, and no subsequent changes in transformation beyond the first frame. N means there were N-1 changes in transformation after the initial received frame.

histogram.name: Media.MediaStreamManager.DesktopVideoDeviceUpdate
histogram.summary: Records media stream request responses for desktop-video capture media-device-update requests.

histogram.name: Media.MediaStreamManager.DisplayVideoDeviceUpdate
histogram.summary: Records media stream request responses for display-video capture media-device-update requests.

histogram.name: Media.MediaVideoVisibilityTracker.ComputeOcclusion.ComputeOccludingArea.TotalDuration
histogram.summary:
Total duration in microseconds taken by the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker to compute occluding area. The histogram is recorded every time an element occluding a target HTMLVideoElement is found, during the ComputeOcclusion operation.
Note that clients without high-resolution clocks will report 0 for very short times.

histogram.name: Media.MediaVideoVisibilityTracker.ComputeOcclusion.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: Total duration in milliseconds taken by the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker to compute occlusion. The histogram is recorded every time the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker needs to compute if a tracked HTMLVideoElement meets its specified visibility threshold.

histogram.name: Media.MediaVideoVisibilityTracker.GetClientIdsSet.ItemsInSetCount.TotalCount
histogram.summary: Total number of entries in the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker ClientIdsSet. Recorded every time the tracker requests the set.

histogram.name: Media.MediaVideoVisibilityTracker.GetClientIdsSet.NotContentType.Percentage
histogram.summary:
Records the percentage of the total ClientIdsSet entries that are ignored due to their DisplayItem::Type not being of "Content" type.
This metric only accounts for non "Content" type entries that are present at the end of the DisplayItemList. The count stops at the first DisplayItem::Type that is of "Content" type, when traversing the DisplayItemList from tail to head.
Recorded every time the tracker requests the set.

histogram.name: Media.MediaVideoVisibilityTracker.GetClientIdsSet.NotContentTypeCount.TotalCount
histogram.summary:
Total number of entries not added to the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker ClientIdsSet, because their DisplayItem::Type is not of "Content" type.
This metric only accounts for elements that are present at the end of the DisplayItemList. The count stops at the first DisplayItem::Type that is of "Content" type, when traversing the DisplayItemList from tail to head.
Recorded every time the tracker requests the set.

histogram.name: Media.MediaVideoVisibilityTracker.GetClientIdsSet.SetConstruction.TotalDuration
histogram.summary:
Total duration, in microseconds, taken by the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker to construct a ClientIdsSet. Recorded every time the tracker requests the set.
Note that clients without high-resolution clocks will report 0 for very short times.

histogram.name: Media.MediaVideoVisibilityTracker.OccludingRectsCount.{BucketSizeIncreases}Histogram.TotalCount
histogram.summary:
Total count of rects occluding a target HTMLVideoElement. The histogram is recorded after the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker computes whether the HTMLVideoElement meets the visibility threshold or not.
Count is recorded using a histogram with {BucketSizeIncreases} bucket size increases.
Note that this does not represent all elements that could be considered occluding, since MeetsVisibilityThreshold may return early depending on the size of the occluded area and the visibility threshold.

variant.name: Exponential
variant.summary: Histogram with exponential bucket size increases, for understanding the overall distribution

variant.name: Linear
variant.summary: Histogram with linear bucket size increases, for fine grained detail

histogram.name: Media.MediaVideoVisibilityTracker.UpdateTime.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: Total duration in milliseconds taken by the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker to update HTMLVideoElement s visibility. The histogram is recorded when the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker executes DidFinishLifecycleUpdate.

histogram.name: Media.MediaVideoVisibilityTracker.{NodesCount}.{BucketSizeIncreases}Histogram.TotalCount
histogram.summary:
Total {NodesCount}, hit tested by ComputeOcclusion. The histogram is recorded after the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker computes whether the HTMLVideoElement meets the visibility threshold or not.
Count is recorded using a histogram with {BucketSizeIncreases} bucket size increases.

variant.name: HitTestedNodesContributingToOcclusionCount
variant.summary: Nodes that contribute to occlusion

variant.name: HitTestedNodesCount
variant.summary: All hit tested nodes

variant.name: IgnoredNodesNotOpaqueCount
variant.summary: Nodes ignored due to not being opaque

variant.name: IgnoredNodesUserAgentShadowRootCount
variant.summary: Nodes ignored due to being in the shadow root and of user agent type

variant.name: Exponential
variant.summary: Histogram with exponential bucket size increases, for understanding the overall distribution

variant.name: Linear
variant.summary: Histogram with linear bucket size increases, for fine grained detail

histogram.name: Media.MediaVideoVisibilityTracker.{PercentageCategory}.Percentage
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of the total hit tested nodes that are {PercentageCategory}. The histogram is recorded after the MediaVideoVisibilityTracker computes whether the HTMLVideoElement meets the visibility threshold or not.

variant.name: IgnoredNodesNotOpaque
variant.summary: Nodes that are ignored due to not being opaque

variant.name: IgnoredNodesUserAgentShadowRoot
variant.summary: Nodes that are ignored due to being in the shadow root and of user agent type

variant.name: NodesContributingToOcclusion
variant.summary: Nodes that contribute to occlusion

histogram.name: Media.MicrophoneMuted
histogram.summary: Heuristically detects if the user has muted the microphone or not. Measured approximately four times per minute while an audio input stream is active.

histogram.name: Media.Midi.SendReceiveUsage{BackendType}
histogram.summary:
Reports whether any data was sent or received by {BackendType}. Recorded once per MidiManager instantiation, upon destruction. MidiManager is instantiated when the first Web MIDI client starts a session, and destroyed when the last client ends the session.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M86 to M91; data may be missing.

variant.summary: any kind of MidiManagers

variant.name: .Usb
variant.summary: a MidiManagerUsb

histogram.name: Media.Midi.SysExMessageSizeUpTo1MB
histogram.summary:
Reports sysex message size.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M86 to M91; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.Midi.Usage
histogram.summary:
The MidiManager instance use count, but this is not intended to understand the real API usage because this can be counted by feature scanning scripts that are often used for footprinting. You may want to track SendReceiveUsage to monitor only instances that actually send or receive MIDI messages.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M86 to M91; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.MojoAudioDecoder.Initialized
histogram.summary: Records the status of each call to MojoAudioDecoderService::Initialize().

histogram.name: Media.MojoAudioDecoder.LastDecodeStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of the last call to MojoAudioDecoderService::Decode() prior to destruction of the MojoAudioDecoderService.

histogram.name: Media.MojoStableVideoDecoder.Decode
histogram.summary: This histogram is analogous to Media.MojoVideoDecoder.Decode but for the MojoStableVideoDecoder. It's the delay between a DecoderBuffer (and encoded chunk) input and a decoded frame being produced by the remote StableVideoDecoder. Output once per successful decode. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-05-24 to 2025-09-01; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.MojoVideoDecoder.ActiveInstances
histogram.summary: Records the number of active MojoVideoDecoderService instances that are alive each time an instance becomes active. An instance is active if Decode() has been called at least once. This provides an estimate of the concurrent hardware resource requirements.

histogram.name: Media.MojoVideoDecoder.Decode
histogram.summary: Delay between a DecodeBuffer (and encoded chunk) input and a decoded VideoFrame being produced by the remote MojoVideoDecoder. Output once per successful decode.

histogram.name: Media.MojoVideoDecoder.InitialPlaybackErrorCodecCounter
histogram.summary: Total number of instances of MojoVideoDecoder used by a page (i.e. render frame) when an instance of MojoVideoDecoder encountered a decoding error or a crash during the first 150 frames of a video stream.

histogram.name: Media.MojoVideoDecoder.InitialPlaybackSuccessCodecCounter
histogram.summary: Total number of instances of MojoVideoDecoder used by a page (i.e. render frame) when an instance of MojoVideoDecoder successfuly decode the first 150 frames of a video stream.

histogram.name: Media.MojoVideoEncodeAccelerator.InputStorageType
histogram.summary: The storage type of media::VideoFrame passed to MojoVideoEncodeAccelerator for encoding. The histogram is recorded every frame encode request.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.AudioCodec
histogram.summary: Audio codec used in Media Source Extensions playback. Set when MediaSource addSourceBuffer() is successfully called during playback. Also set twice during a successful SourceBuffer changeType() operation. See issue 535738 for reworking MSE codec histograms to record on each successfully parsed initialization segment (possibly filtered to record only when actual new codec configurations are parsed).

histogram.name: Media.MSE.DemuxerDestructionTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time taken to destroy one ChunkDemuxer object, not including initial background task scheduling delay.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.ExecutionContext
histogram.summary: For each MediaSource instance, records the type of thread that created the instance.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.VideoCodec
histogram.summary: Video codec used in Media Source Extensions playback. Set when MediaSource addSourceBuffer() is successfully called during playback. Also set twice during a successful SourceBuffer changeType() operation. See issue 535738 for reworking MSE codec histograms to record on each successfully parsed initialization segment (possibly filtered to record only when actual new codec configurations are parsed).

histogram.name: Media.MSE.VideoCodec.MP4
histogram.summary: Video codec used in Media Source Extensions playback if the media container is MP4. Set when MediaSource addSourceBuffer() is successfully called during playback. Also set twice during a successful SourceBuffer changeType() operation. See issue 535738 for reworking MSE codec histograms to record on each successfully parsed initialization segment (possibly filtered to record only when actual new codec configurations are parsed).

histogram.name: Media.MSE.VideoCodec.WebM
histogram.summary: Video codec used in Media Source Extensions playback if the media container is WebM. Set when MediaSource addSourceBuffer() is successfully called during playback. Also set twice during a successful SourceBuffer changeType() operation. See issue 535738 for reworking MSE codec histograms to record on each successfully parsed initialization segment (possibly filtered to record only when actual new codec configurations are parsed).

histogram.name: Media.Network.TotalBytesReceived.SRC
histogram.summary: Reports the total bytes received over the network by a ResourceMultiBufferDataProvider instance. One is created each time a src=file playback needs to retrieve non-contiguous data over the network. Value is recorded at destruction time, so may be lost in the event of tab closure. Range is 1kb to 1gb.

histogram.name: Media.Notification.Cast.Count
histogram.summary: The number of Cast media notifications that are currently being displayed. This is recorded when a media notification starts being displayed.

histogram.name: Media.Notification.Cast.UserAction
histogram.summary: Records the type of the action (e.g. pause) whenever the user makes an action on a Cast media notification. Starting and stopping casting is recorded in Media.GlobalMediaControls.MediaCastMode.Start and Media.GlobalMediaControls.MediaCastMode.Stop.

histogram.name: Media.Notification.Count
histogram.summary: The number of media notifications that are currently being displayed (including ones for Cast sessions). This is recorded when a media notification starts being displayed.

histogram.name: Media.Notification.DisplayPage
histogram.summary: The page where the media notification is displayed to users. This is recorded when a media notification starts being displayed.

histogram.name: Media.Notification.Source
histogram.summary: The source of the underlying media session (e.g. ARC, web, Cast) that displayed the media notification. This is recorded when a notification is available to be shown.

histogram.name: Media.Notification.UserAction
histogram.summary: The media session action that a user clicked on a media notification (including ones for Cast sessions).

histogram.name: Media.OutputStreamDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of an audio output stream. Measured in AudioOutputController from when a stream is started until it is stopped. A stream is stopped when it is paused, closed (i.e. destructed), or when a device change event causes it to be restarted.

histogram.name: Media.PepperVideoDecoder.HardwareAccelerationBehavior
histogram.summary: The hardware/software decoding behavior used for a PPB_VideoDecoder API instance. This UMA is recorded when the PepperVideoDecoderHost is destroyed.

histogram.name: Media.PictureInPicture.Android.Action
histogram.summary: Records which Picture-in-Picture button was clicked. This is recorded when the user clicks on a button in the Android Picture-in-Picture window.

histogram.name: Media.PictureInPicture.Disallowed
histogram.summary: Recorded when a picture-in-picture window is closed due to a ScopedDisallowPictureInPicture object. Records whether the closed picture-in-picture window was just opened or already existed when the ScopedDisallowPictureInPicture was created.

histogram.name: Media.PictureInPicture.Tucked
histogram.summary: Recorded when a picture-in-picture window is tucked due to a ScopedTuckPictureInPicture object. Records whether the tucked picture-in-picture window was just opened or already existed when the ScopedTuckPictureInPicture was created.

histogram.name: Media.PictureInPicture.Window.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Total time spent on a Picture in Picture window. The timer starts counting every time the Picture in Picture window manager receives a call to enter Picture in Picture; the time elapsed is recorded when the Picture in Picture window manager receives a call to exit Picture in Picture. This metric is recorded regardless of the Picture in Picture window type (document vs video), and of the reason for closing the window (UI interaction, returning back to opener tab, etc.).

histogram.name: Media.PictureInPicture.Window.TotalTimeV2
histogram.summary:
Total time spent on a Picture in Picture window. The timer starts counting every time the Picture in Picture window manager receives a call to enter Picture in Picture; the time elapsed is recorded when the Picture in Picture window manager receives a call to exit Picture in Picture. This metric is recorded regardless of the Picture in Picture window type (document vs video), and of the reason for closing the window (UI interaction, returning back to opener tab, etc.).
Similar to Media.PictureInPicture.Window.TotalTime, but with a maximum of 10 hours and a bucket size of 100.

histogram.name: Media.PipelineStatus.AudioVideo.{VideoCodec}.{Pipeline}
histogram.summary: Status of the media pipeline at the end of its lifecycle for audio-video streams with {VideoCodec} video codec using {Pipeline}.

variant.name: DDS.HW
variant.summary: RendererImpl with hardware decoder and DecryptingDemuxerStream

variant.name: DDS.SW
variant.summary: RendererImpl with software decoder and DecryptingDemuxerStream

variant.name: DVD
variant.summary: RendererImpl with DecryptingVideoDecoder

variant.name: HardwareSecure.DDS.HW
variant.summary: RendererImpl with hardware decoder and DecryptingDemuxerStream, using hardware secure decryption

variant.name: HardwareSecure.DDS.SW
variant.summary: RendererImpl with software decoder and DecryptingDemuxerStream, using hardware secure decryption

variant.name: HardwareSecure.HW
variant.summary: RendererImpl with hardware decoder and hardware secure decryption

variant.name: HW
variant.summary: RendererImpl with hardware decoder

variant.name: MediaDrm.HardwareSecure
variant.summary: RendererImpl with requested hardware secure decryption and MediaCodecVideoDecoder

variant.name: MediaDrm.SoftwareSecure
variant.summary: RendererImpl with requested software secure decryption and MediaCodecVideoDecoder

variant.name: SoftwareSecure.DDS.HW
variant.summary: RendererImpl with hardware decoder and DecryptingDemuxerStream, using software secure decryption

variant.name: SoftwareSecure.DDS.SW
variant.summary: RendererImpl with software decoder and DecryptingDemuxerStream, using software secure decryption

variant.name: SW
variant.summary: RendererImpl with software decoder

variant.name: UnknownRenderer
variant.summary: an unknown Renderer

histogram.name: Media.PipelineStatus.Start
histogram.summary: Status of the media pipeline starting process (including demuxer and renderer initialization). If the media pipeline is destroyed during the starting process nothing will be reported, but this should relatively rare.

histogram.name: Media.PipelineStatus.{StreamType}
histogram.summary: Status of the media pipeline at the end of its lifecycle for {StreamType} streams.

histogram.name: Media.PlatformVideoDecoding.Decode
histogram.summary: Time for the platform-specific (set of) video decode acceleration command(s) to be executed. Output once per decode request submit.

histogram.name: Media.PlatformVideoDecoding.VideoCodecProfile
histogram.summary: VideoCodecProfile used to Initialize() the platform VideoDecoder implementation; this is emitted once per video (or per track, when using MSE) initialization and after verifying that the codec profile is thought to be supported. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-11-09 to 2025-09-01; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.RebuffersCount{MediaRebufferingCategories}
histogram.summary: Indicates the number of rebuffers a given watch time session had. {MediaRebufferingCategories}

histogram.name: Media.RegionCapture.CropTo.Latency
histogram.summary:
Duration in milliseconds of the time it takes for a BrowserCaptureMediaStreamTrack.cropTo() call to resolve (either successfully or with an error). Note a call which never resolves won't be counted in this metric.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-01-07 to 2025-03-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.RegionCapture.CropTo.Result2
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of calls to BrowserCaptureMediaStreamTrack.cropTo(). Recorded when resolving the promise produced by cropTo().
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-01-07 to 2025-03-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.RegionCapture.ProduceCropTarget.Function.Result
histogram.summary:
Tracks the result of calls to CropTarget.fromElement(). Specifically, this histogram tracks whether a new Promise was produced, and if not, why not. Another histogram tracks the result of new Promises, i.e. whether they were resolved or rejected.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-01-07 to 2025-03-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.RegionCapture.ProduceCropTarget.Promise.Result
histogram.summary:
When CropTarget.fromElement() is called for the first time on a given Element, a new Promise is produced. This histogram tracks the result of this Promise - whether it was resolved or rejected.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2025-01-07 to 2025-03-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AudioBitrate
histogram.summary:
Measured audio content transfer bitrate while remoting content.
NOTE: was expired 2025-02-01 to 2025-03-12, some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AudioChannelLayout
histogram.summary:
Audio channel layout used while remoting content.
NOTE: was expired 2025-02-01 to 2025-03-12, some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AudioCodec
histogram.summary: Audio codec used while remoting content.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AudioSamplesPerSecond
histogram.summary:
Audio sampling rate while remoting audio content.
NOTE: was expired 2025-02-01 to 2025-03-12, some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.AudioSamplesPerSecondUnexpected
histogram.summary:
Audio sampling rate while remoting audio content (atypical values, in Hz).
NOTE: was expired 2025-02-01 to 2025-03-12, some data may be missing.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.Compatibility
histogram.summary: Whether the given media is compatible with media remoting. Recorded whenever the conditions are met to start remoting (e.g. the media element is the dominant page content and is not paused).

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.RemotePlaybackEnabledByPage
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a web page allows content to be remoted. Recorded when the media player finishes loading and when the site changes this attribute afterwards.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.SessionDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of each remoting session.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.SessionStartFailedReason
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason that a session failed to start.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.SessionStartTrigger
histogram.summary: Tracks the trigger for starting a remoting session.

histogram.name: Media.Remoting.SessionStopTrigger{RemotingSessionDuration}
histogram.summary: Tracks the trigger for stopping a remoting session. {RemotingSessionDuration}

variant.name: .Duration0To100MilliSec

variant.summary: remoting sessions have duration in (3, 5] seconds

variant.summary: remoting sessions have duration in (5, 10] seconds

variant.name: .Duration10To15Sec
